content: Once you revoke the consent to use the {{organizationName}} {{productName}} auth data in the service {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} will automatically stop logging into {{name}}. Your account in {{name}} will not be deleted.

comment.text: This translation key is used to describe what happens when a user revokes consent to use their {{organizationName}} {{productName}} authentication data. It will be displayed in a dialog (RevokeDialog) when a user chooses to revoke consent and informs them that their account will not be deleted, but the service will stop logging into their account.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "تفويض" (tafweedh) for "auth data" is not the most natural or accurate translation in this context. A more suitable term would convey the concept of authorization or consent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a term like "بيانات صلاحية" (bayanat salahiyyah) which means 'authorization data' or "بيانات تفويض المستخدم" (bayanat tafweedh al-mustakhdim) which means 'user authorization data'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repetition of '{{organizationName}} {{productName}}' makes the sentence sound awkward in Arabic. While variables are used in the English source, the Arabic translation should strive for a more fluid read.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Rephrase the sentence to avoid the repetition, potentially using a pronoun or a more descriptive phrase to refer to the organization and product.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ləğv etdikdə" (when you revoke) is a bit awkward. A more natural phrasing would be "ləğv etsəniz" or "ləğv etməklə".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{organizationName}} {{productName}} şirkətinin identifikasiya məlumatından {{name}} üçün istifadə etmək icazəsini ləğv etməklə...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "hesabına" appears twice in close proximity. While technically correct, it can be slightly repetitive. Consider rephrasing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{organizationName}} {{productName}} şirkətinin identifikasiya məlumatından {{name}} üçün istifadə etmək icazəsini ləğv etməklə, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} avtomatik olaraq {{name}} daxil olmağı dayandıracaq. {{name}} ünvanındakı hesabınız silinməyəcək.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Consistency in the use of variable placeholders.  Ensure that `{{...}}` is applied consistently throughout the translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Double-check all occurrences of variable placeholders to ensure they are properly formatted and consistently applied.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "logging into" is not ideal. "Влиза в" (vliaz v) literally means 'enters' and while understandable, it's not the most natural way to express logging into a service in Bulgarian. A better phrasing would convey the sense of authentication or access.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: След като отмените съгласието за използване на данните за удостоверяване на {{organizationName}} {{productName}} в услугата {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} автоматично ще спре достъпа си до {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'профил' (profil) is used for 'account'. While not entirely wrong, 'акаунт' (account) is the more common and direct translation in the context of online services.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: След като отмените съгласието за използване на данните за удостоверяване на {{organizationName}} {{productName}} в услугата {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} автоматично ще спре достъпа си до {{name}}. Вашият акаунт в {{name}} няма да бъде изтрит.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Czech translation has an unnecessary period after the first occurrence of '{{organizationName}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the period after '{{organizationName}}' in 'Po odvolání souhlasu s použitím {{organizationName}} {{productName}} autorizačních údajů ve službě {{name}}, {{organizationName}}.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'auth data' is translated as 'autorizačních údajů'. While technically correct, a more natural translation for this context might be 'přístupových údajů'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider translating 'auth data' as 'přístupových údajů' for improved readability and flow.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'Auth-Daten' is an awkward translation of 'auth data'. It's understandable but not ideal. A more natural translation might be 'Authentifizierungsdaten' or 'Zugangsdaten'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'Authentifizierungsdaten' or 'Zugangsdaten' instead of 'Auth-Daten'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While not incorrect, the translation doesn't maintain the same stylistic flow as the English version. The English uses a slightly more conversational tone.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the phrasing to better match the conversational tone of the original English.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "auth data" is translated as "δεδομένων εξουσιοδότησης". While technically correct, it's overly formal and might be confusing for the average user. A simpler translation like "δεδομένων πρόσβασης" (access data) or "δεδομένων σύνδεσης" (connection data) might be more appropriate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider translating "auth data" as "δεδομένων πρόσβασης" or "δεδομένων σύνδεσης".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation retains the English variable placeholders ({{organizationName}}, {{productName}}, {{name}}). While this might be necessary depending on the system rendering the translation, it's preferable for the final user experience to have these replaced with the appropriate values.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the placeholders are replaced with the corresponding values for the target language and platform.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "kirjautumisen tilille" is awkward. It translates literally to "logging into account," but a more natural phrasing would be "kirjautumisen" (logging).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jos peruutat suostumuksen käyttää {{organizationName}} {{productName}} todennustietoja palvelussa {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} lopettaa automaattisesti kirjautumisen {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'tilillä verkkotunnuksessa' is not the best way to express that the account exists within a service. It's overly literal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Tilisi palvelussa {{name}} ei poistu.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "auth data" is translated as "données d'authentification". While technically correct, a more natural and common translation in this context would be "données d'authentification et d'autorisation" or simply "informations d'authentification".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: données d'authentification et d'autorisation or informations d'authentification

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Once you revoke the consent" is translated as "Երբ չեղարկեք".  A more accurate translation would be something like "Երբ չեղարկեք համաձայնությունը" or "Երբ դուք չեղարկեք համաձայնությունը". The current translation is grammatically awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Երբ դուք չեղարկեք համաձայնությունը

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The punctuation after the first sentence feels abrupt. A smoother transition might require a conjunction or a semicolon.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Երբ դուք չեղարկեք համաձայնությունը, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} ավտոմատ կերպով կդադարեցնի մուտքը {{name}}։ Ձեր հաշիվը {{name}}-ում չի ջնջվի։

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "{{organizationName}} {{productName}}" is repeated excessively and could be shortened for better readability. While technically correct, it's a bit clunky in Italian.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to something like "dati di autenticazione del servizio {{organizationName}} {{productName}}" or simply "dati di autenticazione di {{organizationName}}" if the product name is implied.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Il vostro account" is grammatically correct, it's slightly formal for many contexts. A more common and natural phrasing would be "Il tuo account".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change "Il vostro account" to "Il tuo account"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation includes unnecessary spaces around the organizationName and productName variables, which may not be ideal for display.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove unnecessary spaces around the variables. For example, change '{{organizationName}}の{{productName}}' to '{{organizationName}}の{{productName}}'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'revoke the consent to use' is translated a bit too literally. A more natural Korean phrasing would be better. Specifically, the wording around consent revocation feels stilted.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing '사용에 대한 동의를 철회하면' to something like '동의를 취소하면' or '동의를 해제하면' for a more fluent and natural feel.  The best option would depend on the specific tone desired for the overall text.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, the repetition of "{{organizationName}} {{productName}}" in the translation can feel clunky. Depending on the context, it might be possible to use a shorter designation for brevity if the broader context makes it clear what is being referred to.  For example, if {{organizationName}} and {{productName}} frequently appear together.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider if a shortened designation is appropriate for {{organizationName}} {{productName}}, if the surrounding text already provides sufficient context. Alternatively, explore rewording to reduce repetition.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'ຕົກລົງ' is a slightly awkward translation of 'consent' in this context. While technically correct, it's not the most natural phrasing. A more common and clearer term might be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'ການອະນຸຍາດ' (kan anu yat) instead of 'ຕົກລົງ' (tok long) for 'consent'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ຂໍ້ມູນການຮັບຮອງຕົວ' (khomun kan rap hong tua) is a bit verbose. A more concise and readable version might be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider simplifying to 'ຂໍ້ມູນການເຊື່ອມໂຊ້' (khomun kan sieam so) or 'ຂໍ້ມູນການອະນຸຍາດ' (khomun kan anu yat).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "šeit: {{name}}" is awkward and doesn't accurately convey the English meaning of "in {{name}}". It implies a physical location rather than the service.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Kad atsauksiet piekrišanu {{organizationName}} {{productName}} autorizācijas datu izmantošanai pakalpojumā {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automātiski pārtrauksiet pieteikšanos pakalpojumā {{name}}. Jūsu konts pakalpojumā {{name}} netiks izdzēsts.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repeated use of "šeit:" is clunky and unnecessary. It should be removed for better readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove 'šeit:' before each {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Dutch translation uses the plural form 'diensten' (services) after 'in'. It should be singular 'dienst' to match the English usage of 'service'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Zodra u de toestemming voor het gebruik van de {{organizationName}} {{productName}} auth gegevens in de dienst, {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automatisch stoppen met inloggen op {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'stoppen met inloggen op' is slightly awkward in Dutch. A more natural phrasing would be 'stoppen met inloggen bij'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Zodra u de toestemming voor het gebruik van de {{organizationName}} {{productName}} auth gegevens in de dienst, {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automatisch stoppen met inloggen bij {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation is awkwardly phrased and doesn't flow naturally. The repetition of '{{organizationName}} {{productName}}' is jarring.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po wycofaniu zgody na użycie danych autoryzacji dla {{organizationName}} {{productName}} w usłudze {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} przestanie automatycznie logować się w {{name}}. Twoje konto w {{name}} nie zostanie usunięte.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'danych autoryzacji' is technically correct but could be simplified for clarity. Consider using a more common term like 'danych uwierzytelniających' or simply 'danych'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po wycofaniu zgody na użycie danych uwierzytelniających {{organizationName}} dla {{productName}} w usłudze {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} przestanie automatycznie logować się w {{name}}. Twoje konto w {{name}} nie zostanie usunięte.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repetition of '{{organizationName}} {{productName}}' continues to be a problem. The translated sentence reads too awkwardly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po wycofaniu zgody na użycie danych autoryzacji {{organizationName}} dla {{productName}} w usłudze {{name}}, {{organizationName}} przestanie automatycznie logować się w {{name}}. Twoje konto w {{name}} nie zostanie usunięte.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Portuguese translation uses '{{organizationName}} {{productName}}' consistently. It is more natural in Portuguese to use a more fluid phrasing, such as 'dados de autenticação da {{organizationName}} para o {{productName}}' or similar, to avoid the repetition and abruptness.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider revising to something like: 'dados de autenticação da {{organizationName}} para o {{productName}}' to improve flow.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrasing 'A sua conta em {{name}} não será eliminada' is grammatically correct but sounds slightly formal. A more conversational alternative could improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using: 'A sua conta em {{name}} não será apagada.' or 'Sua conta em {{name}} não será excluída.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "de serviciul {{name}}" is awkward and doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'in the service {{name}}'. A more natural translation would be 'în serviciul {{name}}' or 'pentru serviciul {{name}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Odată ce ați revocat consimțământul pentru utilizarea datelor de autentificare {{organizationName}} {{productName}} în serviciul {{name}}/pentru serviciul {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} va opri automat autentificarea pentru {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Spacing after 'Odată ce' should be adjusted for better readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Odată ce ați revocat...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'revoke' is directly translated as 'අ අව revoke කළ පසු'. While understandable, a more natural Sinhala phrasing would be preferable. 'අ අව revoke කළ පසු' sounds abrupt and doesn't quite convey the nuance of revoking consent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබ {{organizationName}} {{productName}} හි අවසරය {{name}} සේවාවේ භාවිතය සඳහා ඉවත් කළ පසු

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repeated use of '{{organizationName}} {{productName}}' makes the sentence clunky. A better phrasing would improve readability. Consider rephrasing to avoid repetition if possible.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider incorporating a pronoun or a more concise reference to the entity if appropriate within the broader context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'autorizačných údajov' is a less common and slightly awkward translation of 'auth data'. A more natural Slovak translation would be 'prístupových údajov' or 'prihlasovacieho dátum'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po odvolaní súhlasu na používanie {{organizationName}} {{productName}} prístupových údajov v službe {{name}},...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "auth data" is not adequately translated. "Avtorizaciji" is a reasonable attempt but might be clearer as "podatkih za avtorizacijo" or similar.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ko prekličete soglasje za uporabo podatkov za avtorizacijo {{organizationName}} {{productName}} v storitvi {{name}},...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "prijavljati" is slightly awkward in this context. While technically correct, it implies logging in repeatedly. A more accurate translation might be "sinhronizirati" (sync) or a phrase indicating data processing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ko prekličete soglasje za uporabo podatkov za avtorizacijo {{organizationName}} {{productName}} v storitvi {{name}}, se bo {{organizationName}} {{productName}} samodejno prenehal sinhronizirati podatke v {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, the repetition of "{{organizationName}} {{productName}}" makes the sentence clunky.  Consider if this can be rephrased for better readability.  While template variables are important, this phrasing might benefit from some restructuring.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to avoid the repetition of "{{organizationName}} {{productName}}" for improved flow. This is dependent on broader context and desired tone.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "опозовете" (opozovete) implies a stronger action than "revoke".  While technically correct, a more suitable translation for "revoke" in this context would be "укинете" (ukinete) or "повучете" (povučete).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Када укинете/повучете пристанак за коришћење...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses Cyrillic script. Ensure consistency with the source language formatting, and that the platform/system supports Cyrillic display.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: N/A - Ensure proper display support for Cyrillic

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The double curly braces `{{...}}` are inconsistent throughout. They appear to be intended as placeholders.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent use of `{{...}}` or another chosen placeholder format throughout the translated text.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Turkish translation includes repeated use of "{{organizationName}} {{productName}}". While acceptable, it can be slightly clunky. Consider a more natural phrasing or variable substitution if possible within the context of the UI.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Explore alternative phrasing to avoid repetition. For example, if '{{organizationName}} {{productName}}' refers to a specific entity, consider using a pronoun or a shorter reference in subsequent mentions.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "входити до" (vkhodyty do) is not the most natural way to express "logging into" in Ukrainian. A more accurate translation would be something like "автоматично не зможе входити" (avtomatichno ne змоzhe vkhodyty) or "перестане автоматично заходити" (pereстане avtomatichno zakhodyty).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Після того як ви відкликаєте згоду на використання даних аутентифікації {{productName}} {{organizationName}} в службі {{name}}, {{productName}} {{organizationName}} перестане автоматично заходити до {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repetition of '{{productName}} {{organizationName}}' is awkward. While it's present in the English, a more fluent Ukrainian might rearrange or omit one instance if the meaning is clear from context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Після того як ви відкликаєте згоду на використання даних аутентифікації {{productName}} {{organizationName}} в службі {{name}}, {{productName}} припинить автоматично заходити до {{name}}. Your account in {{name}} will not be deleted.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Vietnamese translation contains a double rendering of '{{productName}}{{organizationName}}'. This is likely a formatting error and should be a single entity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace '{{productName}}{{organizationName}}' with '{{productName}} {{organizationName}}' or '{{organizationName}} {{productName}}' depending on the desired order, to match the English source.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The variable `{{organizationName}} {{productName}}` appears multiple times. While technically correct, it might be more readable to use a more concise format or a single variable like `{{app_name}}` or `{{service_name}}` if possible in the overall localization system. This isn't necessarily an error, but a suggestion for improved clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider consolidating `{{organizationName}} {{productName}}` into a single variable for consistency and readability, e.g., `{{app_name}}` or `{{service_name}}`.
